basics.name: Urian Chang
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Software engineer with a strong background in software QA testing. Experienced in web development with modern front-end and back-end technologies, SQL and NoSQL database query languages, and RESTful APIs. Eager to tackle new challenges with a collaborative team and build innovative products.

work.summary: Responsible for evaluating compatibility, functionality, and usability of InFocus collaboration software.
highlights: Started as Software QA Engineer. Promoted to Senior Software QA Engineer.
Consistently recognized as the top performing tester in the software QA department (15 people).
Authored and executed test plans in TestRail for InFocus applications on desktop and mobile platforms, including Windows, iOS, and Android.
Created custom system images for Windows 7, 8.1, and 10 for production deployment.
Created Python script to manage the company's AWS instances.

work.summary: Responsible for executing device testing/certification tasks, tracking and resolving project issues in a timely manner and managing project deliverables and deadlines.
highlights: Started as Software & Hardware Test Intern. Promoted to Lead Intern, Product Analyst, and Device Test Lead.
Successfully reached Technical Approval for new products with Open Mobile and T-Mobile GoSmart.
Created guides for device launch timelines and requirements for future product planning and management.
Organized and created After Action Review and Lessons Learned PowerPoint presentations for internal and external reviews at the end of the T-Mobile GoSmart project.

projects.name: LearnKanjiSkip
projects.description: Web-based learning platform on how to use the system of kanji indexing by patterns (SKIP). User progresses through levels to practice and become familiar with kanji SKIP codes.
highlights: Designed and developed the website, using Angular for front-end, Express for back-end, and MongoDB for database.
Collaborated in a team of three developers, using GitHub to track and merge development changes.
Created a Python script to parse through a kanji dictionary (XML) and generate a JSON file for the database.
Deployed with Amazon Web Services EC2

projects.name: Let's Fly Away
projects.description: An iOS game in which the player flies around the sky collecting lost balloons.
highlights: Solely developed the iOS mobile game for the SpriteKit hackathon at Coding Dojo from March 10 - 13, 2017.
Designed sprites using Microsoft Paint and sourced music and sound effects from online resources.
Configured physics bodies with the SpriteKit framework to detect collisions and gravitational forces.
Implemented a motion tracking feature with the Core Motion framework.

projects.name: ChorusLine
projects.description: A lightweight music composition app for iOS mobile devices.
highlights: Designed and developed in a team of three developers, using Swift and Xcode 8.
Built a grid of physics bodies with SpriteKit to detect collisions and play specific notes.
Implemented data persistence with Core Data.

projects.name: RunBud
projects.description: A jogging companion app built for iOS mobile devices to track and share running routes.
highlights: Designed and developed in a team of three developers, using Swift and Xcode 8.
Implemented features to record and display running routes with the Map Kit framework.
Completed for the Map Kit hackathon at Coding Dojo from March 16 - 17, 2017.

projects.name: JavaScript Code Editor
projects.description: Solely developed a JavaScript code editor with the Electron framework and Monaco editor.
